reviewText: why would you do that? only stupid people do that and kalinda is not stupid, nor is eli.this is another instance of writers getting sloppy in the pursuit of gratuitous drama.sure, kalinda would call, but when eli tells her that alicia is about to go on the mic, she would just say, ok, i will call back in 20 minutes. or something.  or if she is too distraught to avoid being a douchebag, then surely eli would have the presence of mind to realize that it can wait.it is out of character for kalinda to react this way.  she's a hard-ass. so is eli.great series in general, but the writers get lazy sometimes and allow the characters to be uncharacteristically stupid in order to further the plot.  it irritates.

reviewText: where is the Blu-Ray?Am tired of studios not releasing series like "Good Wife" "Elementary" "NYPD Blue" & "ER"  (for starters) in blu-ray.  Drag yourselves into this decade, please.  As a collector/buyer of actual "I want to hold them in my hand" DVDs, I will only buy blu-ray.  And yet so many of my favorite (repeat viewing is a given) series are not released in the BD format."Good Wife" is superb.  And that's an understatement.  Writing/acting/editing/storylines et al.  But looks like I'll never own it 'cuz of the outdated format.  *sigh*  And at my age, the studios better hurry up and change that. *grins*You people who still are happy with standard DVD, I cannot recommend this series highly enough.

reviewText: This is such a great show.  The actors are well selected and do their profession most excellent.  This episode was truly a surprise, didn't see it coming and nobody could have.  The tensions that exist between Alicia, Will and Peter; Kalnida and Cary....WOW!  I have watched this program from the beginning and it is one of the best I have ever seen  Highly encourage the entire series, if you only watch THIS episode, you truly won't get the shock value.
Title: The Good Wife: Season 5

reviewText: This series just keeps getting better and better.  The actors are top-notch and the writing is intelligent, discerning, and topical.  The characters are fleshed out; not one-dimensional as is the case of many dramas today.  Julia Margulies plays the "good wife" who is married to the philandering Chicago state's attorney (played superbly by Chris Noth).  She returns to work as a lawyer after a 15-year hiatus spent raising her children.  Without giving anything away, the upheaval in her life is challenging and demanding.  I watched the first 4 seasons on Amazon, one right after the other.  Season 5 offers the same high quality entertainment, with all its twists and turns; I am eager to see what this year brings.For those who like political and romantic intrigue, this is the cherry on top of the sundae.
summary: The Good Wife No Longer Leads the Good Life
Title: The Good Wife: Season 5

reviewText: Never expected the outcome!  Sad but a great send-off for Will.  The remainder of the season will be very interesting to watch.

Title: The Good Wife: Season 5

reviewText: I love the fact that while this is season five of THE GOOD WIFE, directors and writers have created a whole new direction for the program to go.  While other television series start to fade out at about the fourth or fifth season, THE GOOD WIFE begins their fifth season with bang and the audience is on a wild ride as Alysia, Cary and the rest of the fourth years leave LOCKHART & GARDNER to begin their own firm.  This story-line creates a myriad of new episode possibilities as the two factions begin an all-out war and we have front row seats as the fighting and maneuvering continues to escalate as the season progresses.They have also added a secondary story-line in which Alysia's husband Peter Florrick, the governor elect, joins forces with his wife's new firm, much to the dismay of his right hand man Eli.  Eli realizes that Peter's continuing alliance with the firm could be his downfall and create new controversies as his favoritism may lead him to compromise his gubernatorial ethics.  Exciting and fresh, this season could be the best one yet.UPDATE: This review was more helpful at the time the episode "Hit The Fan" was shown or before.  At this point in the series other scenarios have take place which make what I have previously stated to not completely follow the way the plot-line has continued.  Please only rate this review with this information in mind.
summary: Season Five Begins With a Bang ! (UPDATE)
Title: The Good Wife: Season 5

reviewText: I love this show!  Takes a dramatic twist this season. The original cast is amazing and has celebrity guest appearances that enhance episodes.

reviewText: Excellent acting . Terrific story line  defence teams are not always clear  need more love between will and Alicia. A+

reviewText: Though I still love The Good Wife and will not miss an episode, I have become tired of where the show is going.  I hated seeing what went down between Alicia, Will and Diane when Alicia and Cary went off to start their own firm.  It felt like such a betrayal to the camaraderie of these characters.  Even more than that, I began to really dislike Alicia's character.  She has always been somewhat standoffish and remote, but the past year has turned her selfish and vindictive and really unlikable.  It's very sad because this show has been can't miss for me.  Then...with what happened to Will...I just don't know where's it heading. But I'll stick around to find out.
Title: The Good Wife: Season 5

reviewText: The best show on Network Television just got better...and in its 5th season! reviewText: the lead character has always been a tad on the goody two shoes side.  this was especially the way we found her in season 1, the political wife whose husband was using prostitutes.  so she had to go back to work as the lawyer she used to be. (the elliott spitz couple most closely resemble this situation) what i really like about season 5 is that the lead is at last allowed to be as assertive, aggressive and in your face as every other lawyer in this show. specifically, she goes ahead and does what the season closed with last year, that she and Cary were going to start their own firm. they are also planning on taking a lot of key clients with them. This is really good stuff and everyone gets very down and dirty.  unfortunately, michale j. fox left this show to go shoot his own show.  that is too bad.  i have seen his new show and this one was a much better vehicle for him. finally, if one thought alicia and peter had quite the meltdown couple wise, wait until you catch will's meltdown this season.

reviewText: For many years, I have found "The Good Wife" to be must see Television and this year is no exception.  The trickery and deception between the two law firms is delicious.  Florick and Argos and Lockhart & Gardner, use all kinds of dirty tricks to get clients and therefore, more money.  All of the principles know each other so well and are able to use that knowledge in order to get the upper hand in order to out do the other parties.Kalinda and Marilyn are the wild cards who use their womanly skills to get what they want from their partners.  Especially Kalinda who can pretty much get secrets from Cary although Cary is a good match for Kalinda.  Marilyn is doing a strong battle against Peter Florick and his chief of staff in the ethics battle.This tv show has drama, sex, and some comedy and should continue to be great for the rest of the season.
summary: The Good Wife has found its footing once again
Title: The Good Wife: Season 5

reviewText: Update: After the initial squabbling between the new firms calmed down, the show started to get real good again.  Now the last episode on March 23rd. This was a shocking episode losing one the the main characters in this show.  My gosh what a shock.  I read that Mr. Charles(will)actually requested being written out of the show for whatever reasons he has.  So this is how they did it.  The show will greatly miss him, but it might keep the show going with so many more story lines.VERY INTERESTING!!!!The break up episode when Alicia splits with her law firm was very exciting and promised a lot in intrigue in the future.  So why the three stars? The first thing that ruined it for me is when a 30 million dollar account swithced back and forth between the the present law firm and the new one headed up by Cary and Alicia, by slinging mud at each other.  Whoever visited last won the account.  The truth is,the firm wouldn't have dealt with either one with both looking like idiots.The second issue for me is Alicia's character.  She is shown to be an extremely intelligent, mature woman with a real head on her shoulders.  It already appeared that her reconcilliation with her husband was forced and acted out for her benefit.Twice at differently times in the series, the now Governor elect(her husband) came into her house, this time with a party going on at the time, and she willingly had sex with him highlighted by her turning back after they were finished to fetch her panties and pull them up.  Alluring?  Not in this case.  It just wasn't her character.  In another episode in season 3 or 4, Alicia was late for a very important meeting.  In comes the husband who she is separated from, puts her up against the wall, pulls down the underwear and they go to it standing up.  All the while she is moaning and acting like she was enjoying it.I certainly have nothing against sex, but under the circumstances, it was really ridiculous.I'm  not sure whether I'm done with this otherwise well written, well acted show because the story line and characters are getting "out there".Season 5 started out just great like the others, but what's missing in this big change episode is the believability of what's going on.
Title: The Good Wife: Season 5

reviewText: Just waiting to get more seasons, hope very soon !Surprisingly different than what I expected in this series.Keep them coming ...PLEASE !

Thanks Gina

reviewText: Note: I saw every episode of this season via XFinity On Demand.So, I'm IV seasons late for THE GOOD WIFE, and as a result, it took me a handful of episodes to understand who the main characters were & their motivations for what they do. However, that did not lessen my enjoyment of what is clearly an intense legal drama (even if I don't understand all the courtroom legal jargon). The acting is first-rate, and the writing smart & snappy. The episode 'Hitting The Fan' was one of the best, but clearly not the only one. The final minutes of 'Dramatics, Your Honor' & the subsequent episode were clearly the best ones in terms of drama. The tension was high, and the writing very well done. 'Tying The Knot' was evidently a very different episode, and there was a ghost behind the camera on this one (wink, wink). I can't wait to see how that storyline is resolved. Matthew Goode does a very good American accent, and Michael J. Fox sheds his Marty McFly persona for something more sinistrous, if not overtly villainous.THE GOOD WIFE has been renewed for a sixth season.
summary: I'm Late To The Party, But It's Still A Good Time...
Title: The Good Wife: Season 5

reviewText: I really want to like Julianna Margulies, as Alicia Florrick, but her acting portrays the "dynamic" Alicia as a stiff manikin-like character, with marginal moral and ethical grounding when it comes to herself but pristine expectations when it comes to others. In Alicia’s world, her wrongs still make others wrong and her right.  These incredible dynamics could be acted out so much more dynamically than the stiff cardboard portrayal by Marguiles. The best part about this past season was that she and Will finally broke up their mismatched love affair and then thankfully, in the new season, Will is finally dead and gone! Chris Noth, Alan Cumming, and Graham Phillips all demonstrate excellent acting chops, while Matt Czuchry’s acting and character are stiff and thin at best. Also kudos to Carrie Preston for both her acting and ADHD character dynamics; she’s a true gem!
summary: Thank Goodness Will Was Kicked To The Side!
Title: The Good Wife: Season 5

reviewText: This show is better every year. Looking forward to Sundays show..It will be quite an explosion at the law firm. By the way I love all the actors on this show. The writing is great too.

It's so suspenseful and keeps you on the edge of your seat.

reviewText: Storylines are varied and intriguing.  Lots of surprises.  Fast paced action.  Return of "friends" from previous seasons.  Loved seeing Nathan Lane turning up this week. Looks like he'll be around for awhile.  Gary Cole's character keeps the blood flowing.  No one can be complacent with his opposite views.  "David Lee" somehow gets worse and "they" are letting him.  What an obnoxious guy!  Love seeing "Alicia"s kids have their own avenues of exploration.  What neat kids they are.  Shock!  The ethics gal is pregnant.  Hmmm!  Who's the guy?  Is she married?  Did I miss something?  The script writers are certainly tantalizing we viewers.

reviewText: The inaugural episode of this season of The Good Wife is worth a play and a re-play for its tightly wound acting and action.  The dramatics are flawless and the script spares not a single word.  Even if you have never seen this series before, I recommend you seeing this episode because it is television drama at its best.  That includes the synchronization of music, so well chosen, as well as the light humor in the robotic tele-commuter.  Kudos all around.
Title: The Good Wife: Season 5

reviewText: I have only one question: Where is the love? The anchoring plot of this show has always been the on-again, off-again love affair of Will and Alicia, and the tension it creates in her marriage to Peter. This season, everything has gone to shambles and there are more ugly confrontations in one episode than take place in an entire year in divorce court. Everyone is out to destroy everyone else, words are vicious, actions are duplicitous, characters are two-faced. David Lee used to shock us with his meanness and crassness: now everyone's become David Lee. Knowing that Alicia and Will can never come back from the treachery and ugliness they've aimed at the other removes the show's biggest draw for me: the question of whether they will ever find love with each other.So where's the tension now?  Law firm versus law firm. Who will prevail, Lockhart Gardner or Florrick Agos? Who cares? I'm not rooting for Alicia's side, because all she'll gain by winning is (1) having a bigger client caseload which takes her away from life's important things like love and family, (2) hurting Will even more.I think the writers have taken a terrible turn this season, causing all the show's drama to revolve around the question of which group of devious, back-stabbing, lying, deceiving lawyers will be the most successful.  Again I ask: who cares?And again I ask: where is the love?
Title: The Good Wife: Season 5

reviewerName: Retired "Retired, and enjoying my free time. ...
reviewText: Season 5 is sizzling!! I like all the changes and reinvention of the storylines and character's stepping out of their comfort zones.I'm not usually a fan of court dramas. BUT, I started watching season 1 and then couldn't stop. Over a two week period I'd watched all 4 seasons and enjoyed every minute!!  Each episode is so well scripted and engrossing, the characters are well developed and interesting, and you just cannot predict what will happen next. I like that it's not predictable and boring.  The courtroom drama is always well done and very similar to what happens in real courtrooms. So it's believeable. I also like that they have 5 lawyers who are scriptwriters for the show, and also lawyer technical support, all keeping it real.I am a fan of this show and will keep watching. I would rather pay to watch it without commercial distractions which tend to stop the flow of the story. It's that good. Yes I get CBS, but I don't want the commercials.
Title: The Good Wife: Season 5

reviewText: Brilliant TV drama giving all the others contenders  (Sopranos, Mad Men, Breaking Bad) a run for the money. Full of unexpected twists and subtle performances, it is first rate and yet, surprisingly, a product of network television. Kudos.

reviewText: I very much enjoyed the first 4 seasons, but here we have some strange turn of events.I don't understand what motivates Alicia to leave the firm and in such a clandestine way?It seems to be out of character.  That disturbed me enough to not want to pay for the episodes.I listened to an interview with the writers whose intention it is to have Alicia become a stronger person.I found their method to be artificial.The other disturbing fact was the loss of a main character.  I don't want to give away what happens,but this character is one I have appreciated.  The fact that this person was tired of acting in this seriesmakes me wonder if things were disturbing to this person as well?It is in general a very interesting, well written series and perhaps others will be more accepting of the changes than I.
Title: The Good Wife: Season 5

reviewText: SCANDAL-JUST OKTHE GOOD WIFE--FANTASTICI am so frustrated by those tv folk who rave every week about Scandal; don't these people ever watch The Good Wife. In my opinion (sound familiar) this show is far and above anything on television. I watch it on my Kindle Fire so I can go back and remind myself what happened the week before making it an even greater experience.All the stars, all the plot lines, the court scenes  remind me a bit of Perry Mason--always pulling something out of a hat. The judges are a hoot; the whole cast is awesome and the writing is top notch.I won't go into all the 'who's and what's' - I think I covered that in one of my other reviews of this show but suffice it to say this is one spectacular hour(s) and if you haven't seen it catch up; I guarantee you'll love it and put Scandal down one notch on the ladder of greatness and The Good Wife at the top!!!

Title: The Good Wife: Season 5

reviewText: I have never enjoyed any of the courtroom or police dramas but this show is interesting and actually exciting. Very intelligently written with characters of some depth. The writers do the continuous background story very well and with each episode a self-contained story with a beginning and usually climactic ending.This season's first two episodes looks like the show is actually getting better.In general what I like about the show is its' exploration of liberalism. I mean REAL liberalism and not the Orwellian double-speak of today in which authoritarianism, intolerance, and love of the State is referred to as being "liberal". Whether it is feminism, guns, or religion it is presented through the lens of American liberalism. Instead of "sides" winning out it seems it is the Individual that is considered the most relevant entity - a complex Human that doesn't just swallow tribal rhetoric then spits out singular agendas. Much self-interest prevents such a thing and the show is unapologetic about this.It is also fascinating to observe extreme objectivity, I mean "cut-throat" at times, and of course the Law is a perfect place to explore this.It's sort of like the show "House" except it is a team of lawyers instead of doctors.
summary: Likely the best written show on TV.
Title: The Good Wife: Season 5

reviewText: Well done series. Love Chicago politics and the series does not disappoint. Highly recommend all series and episodes. Held my interest throughout all 5 seasons.
summary: interesting and always building on previous episodes
Title: The Good Wife: Season 5

reviewText: The first three series of this mixed family-saga and legal-procedural were really outstanding, with excellent acting that included the teenage children of a lawyer-political family on the brink of a divorce following discovery of the husband's unfaithfulness.  This drama, played out against the wife's re-entry into the legal profession in order to gain independence from the family constraints provided a nice plot line offering different types of drama in the same episodes as the family and the legal and the business issues unfolded in parallel.  Then the production values changed, new Executive Producers joined the ranks, one of the key promoters committed suicide and the fourth series became comedic and poorly plotted, with "guest appearances" by lots of aging stars looking for a come-back to the public eye.  The fifth series followed the path of the fourth, and although somewhat better in a few episodes, in terms of connections to reality rather than dissolving into farce, the program would not have survived so long if it had started out like series 4 and 5 during series 1. It has just lost its way and been taken in by its own earlier success [and excellence].
Title: The Good Wife: Season 5

reviewText: This program is very good and is more thoughtful than many hour-long programs. Just when you begin to worry that it is going to sink into a soap-opera of sex, remorse and political turmoil, you are plunged back into a difficult court case or a fun moment, or a question on ballot recounts. It is written much as life happens, one event, problem, laugh, scare after another. Roller coaster.
summary: The Good Wife is a good mix of legal, political and personal life at the top.
Title: The Good Wife: Season 5

reviewText: Thanks to my Amazon Prime:I truly love the fact that the day right after the episode has aired, I can purchase it, and see it commercial-free!This is one of those series that hooks you from moment one.  The characters are so easily believable; the drama is non-stop and leaves you with that open-ended, last second tidbit, that keeps you coming back for more!  I love it!

Title: The Good Wife: Season 5

reviewText: So far season 5 has been the best season yet.  A casual watcher, the moment Alicia and Cary left the firm, I became a real fan.  Those few episodes, filled with suspense and drama, were incredible.  I loved seeing the firms feuding over clients, battling in court, and doing everything in their power to one-up the opposition.  Great episodes.  Then, if things couldn’t get better, they kill off one of the main characters.  Sad to see Will go, but it made for great television.  Hopefully the show will continue to improve as it goes on, but if not, it’s had a nice run so far.  I recommend anybody who enjoys a good legal drama or show in general to check it out.
Title: The Good Wife: Season 5

reviewText: This is a great show! It's got great actors, it's funny, irreverent and smart.  I was sad when I realized I had seen all the seasons available to me on Hulu, and I finished Season 5 2 weeks ago.  I can't wait until season 6 is available!

reviewText: She crossed the line. There was hope that the character would get married to Kurt and keep walking without trying to hurt or undermine Alicia and Wil's relationship.  Now we are seeing it for what it is: jealousy.If Diane was out to hurt Wil professionally, she would have let the surprise happen for him when everyone walked out of the door at the same time.  We now see the past criticisms of Alicia in the light of attempting to compete for Wil's attention or affection or both.Wil could find a better partner than Alicia anyway. In my view, it is no loss for him.As for Cary, if I were Alicia and just had to grab an attorney and some client's ... I would have taken the lustful investor (Colin Sweeney) and the drug dealer (Lemmond Bishop) and looked up Mr. Bond (Derrick Bond), for a partner instead of Cary.What Wil and Alyssia seem to have in common is that they would both prefer partners that they can control.
Title: The Good Wife: Season 5
